call_title: Ergo PoW Blockchain - Weekly Update & AMA - June 19th

topics.title: Node 6.0 Release and Mining Pool Updates
topics.summary: kushti announces the final 6.0 release scheduled for today, along with mining pool instructions. Discussion covers the difference between LevelDB (5.0 versions) and RocksDB (5.1 versions) releases, with 6.0 being LevelDB-based for mining pool compatibility.

topics.title: SigmaChain Refactoring and Merge-Mined Sidechains
topics.summary: kushti discusses the published SigmaChain refactoring plan and identifies merge-mined sidechains as low-hanging fruit. Mentions conversation with Bruno about Zephyr, a Djed-based private stablecoin that's essentially a Monero fork with Djed implementation.

topics.title: 5th Anniversary Celebration and Video Content
topics.summary: Discussion of upcoming July 1st anniversary plans including video content creation by Dan, pixel, Andy and Angie. Community tradition of sending ERGs to Raro for anniversary cake celebration is mentioned.

topics.title: Glasgow On-Ramp Integration Progress
topics.summary: Update on US on-ramp fundraising success and Glasgow integration. All details have been submitted, contract finalization expected in a few weeks with potential end-July launch. Excitement about potential integration into Nautilus wallet and Rosen Bridge.

topics.title: Ergo Meetup and Hackathon Planning
topics.summary: Colorado meetup schedule to be finalized this Sunday with both in-person and live-streamed components. Hackathon will include AI coding and traditional coding groups both on-site and online to maximize participation.

topics.title: Rosen Bridge Doge Integration and Maintenance
topics.summary: Rosen Bridge Dogecoin integration is nearing completion after resolving technical challenges. Emphasis on regular maintenance of watchers and guards, recommending weekly bounces to prevent synchronization issues.

topics.title: AI Coding Development and Ergo Compatibility
topics.summary: kushti expresses amazement at rapid AI coding progress on Ergo. Discussion of Ergo's AI-friendly nature due to endpoints, Python integration, and ErgoScript approach making development accessible for AI tools.

topics.title: Kaspa Mixer Analysis and Privacy Concerns
topics.summary: Analysis of Kaspa's new custodial mixer and comparison to Ergo's non-custodial approach. Discussion of privacy limitations in coinjoin mixers due to networking layer vulnerabilities and coordination service tracking risks.

topics.title: Mempool Visualizer Demo and Tools
topics.summary: Demonstration of AI-coded mempool visualizer showing real-time Ergo transactions with color coding for different transaction types including peer-to-peer and oracle transactions. Plans to integrate with SIGS mining pool for hash rate display.

topics.title: Sub-blocks Deployment Timeline
topics.summary: kushti estimates sub-blocks could be fully deployed by end of year, with public testnet injection possible around July. Timeline dependent on 6.0 activation, which could happen October 1st if voting starts July 1st.

topics.title: Paideia Governance Engagement Issues
topics.summary: qx() expresses frustration about lack of community engagement on Paideia governance proposals, specifically the Kraken listing proposal having zero comments despite community interest in chats. Calls for active participation rather than passive interest.

topics.title: Private DEX and Sandwich Attack Prevention
topics.summary: Discussion of private DEX concepts and sandwich attack mitigation strategies. kushti explains how direct execution without proxy contracts (like in Dexy) can prevent sandwiching, and how slippage settings and order batching could provide privacy and MEV protection.

topics.title: Merge-Mined Sidechains Documentation
topics.summary: kushti references ErgoHack 8 documentation for merge-mined sidechains and mentions possibility of two-way trustless pegging, which isn't possible on Bitcoin. Offers to collaborate with developers interested in expanding sidechain documentation.

topics.title: Stablecoin Ecosystem and ChainCash Integration
topics.summary: Discussion of how algorithmic stablecoins like those from Bruno's work could integrate with centralized stablecoins through ChainCash. kushti describes ChainCash as a "great equalizer" allowing multiple issuers from major corporations to individuals.
